task-wr.title: Changing the NTP Server Configuration
task-wr.shortdesc: You can change the NTP server addresses defined for HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade at any time after installation.

context.p: During software installation, HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade is configured with up to three NTP server IP addresses. You change these addresses using the web administration interface or the CLI.

prereq.p: Before changing NTP server addresses, review the Fault Management page and ensure that any existing system alarms are cleared.

note.p: For the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade system to use FQDN servers instead of IPv4 servers, at least one valid DNS server must be specified.

step.cmd: In the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade web administration interface, open the System Configuration pane.

info.p: The System Configuration pane is available from the System Panel section of the Admin menu.

stepresult.p: The NTP page appears, showing the currently defined NTP servers and their IP addresses.
The Edit NTP dialog box appears.

step.cmd: Replace the NTP Server IP addresses or names with different ones as required.

info.p: If you specify the NTP servers using FQDNs you must have at least one valid DNS server defined on your system. You must use IP addresses otherwise.
This raises major alarms against the controllers and services. You can view the alarms on the Fault Management page.

step.cmd: Lock and unlock the controllers to clear the alarms.

info.p: Open the Hosts list by clicking Inventory on the System Panel section of the Admin menu, and then selecting the Hosts tab. Hosts requiring attention are shown with the status Config out-of-date.
To lock or unlock a host, click More for the host and then use the menu selections.
Wait for the lock operation to be completed.
Wait for the host to become available. It is updated with the new NTP server addresses, and its error message is cleared.

substep.cmd: Perform a swact on the active controller.

info.p:
Click More Swact Host
for the active controller.

substep.cmd: Lock the original controller (now in standby mode).

info.p: Wait for the lock operation to be completed.
Wait for it to become available. It is updated with the new NTP server addresses, and its error message is cleared.

step.cmd: Ensure that the 250.001 Configuration out-of-date alarms are cleared for both controllers.
